instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: macbook 12" keyboard issue
threads.message: I have a wonderful 12" macbook which had a bad key.  i got a new keyboard from china (first one only the power key seemed to work) this one does fine until i literally screw the bottom case screws on.  then it does what the first one they sent me did, power key works but nothing else responds. i unscrew the bottom open it up and try again and everything works again, until you try to screw the bottom back on.  i imagine something is shorting it? i see there is a metal ground looking perimeter which the original black foil covered but may not be doing so well after removal, so i kaptan tapped it along the bottom near the trackpad where it seemed exposed just in case that was it but still no total solution.  any ideas?

threads.title: macbook 12" keyboard issue
threads.message: The "protective" shield you ripped off the old keyboard is damaged and now the conductive layer is touching the exposed traces on the keyboard. You can get these new, I believe they call them "backlight" on Ebay but it is just an adhesive shield.
